drinkName.name: White Walker Flip
drinkName.about: Love Game of Thrones and sophisticated drinks? Try this Scotch cocktail. Winter is coming.

ingredients.ingredient: The Glenrothes Select Reserve Single Malt Scotch Whisky

mix.how: Add the egg to a shaker and shake without ice until emulsified.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake very well and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Sin Cyn
drinkName.about: Try this simple but sophisticated scotch-and-Cynar cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Chopin Harvest Martini
drinkName.about: This pear cocktail gets a boost from bubbly.

ingredients.ingredient: Pear purée (one or two fresh pears pureed with a dash of sugar or simple syrup)

mix.how: Coat the rim of a chilled Martini glass with the red sugar and set aside.
Add the vodka and pear purée to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Top with Champagne and float a pear slice on top.

drinkName.name: Polar Bear
drinkName.about: You don’t need to be in the Arctic to enjoy this mezcal cocktail recipe.

ingredients.ingredient: Tempus Fugit Spirits Crème de Menthe

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.

ingredients.ingredient: Sauza Blue Silver Tequila or other blanco tequila

mix.how: Combine the poblano and tequila in a large jar or other container with a lid.
Cover, and let stand for 1 week.
If the infusion is not spicy enough, add the habanero and let stand for 1 day more.
Strain before using.

drinkName.name: 10 Cane Hemingway Daiquiri
drinkName.about: Try the delicious and simple rum-based Hemingway Daiquiri. Papa approved!

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel and black cherry on a skewer.

drinkName.name: Michael Collins Honeysuckle
drinkName.about: Bring out Irish whiskey’s sweet side.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail or stemless wine glass.
Garnish with a thin apple slice.

drinkName.name: Rhubarb Fix
drinkName.about: Get refreshed with this icy-cold rhubarb, sherry and gin cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Breakfast Martini
drinkName.about: This tart-and-sweet gin drink is good at any time of day.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake very hard and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Float a lemon wheel on top.

drinkName.name: Rhubarb & Strawberry Collins
drinkName.about: Two of springtime’s most delicious ingredients combine in this tart and refreshing tipple.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a pickled rhubarb stalk and a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Spiced Rhubarb Gimlet
drinkName.about: A coriander-pink peppercorn rhubarb shrub makes this tasty treat a complex spring cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and double-strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a pickled rhubarb stalk.

drinkName.name: Raspberry Caipirinha
drinkName.about: A tasty twist on a Brazilian classic.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the sugar, raspberries and lime.
Add the cachaça and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and pour (unstrained) into a rocks glass.
Garnish with an additional raspberry.

drinkName.name: Neighborhood Negroni
drinkName.about: It would be rude not to introduce yourself to the neighborhood with this delightful Negroni recipe.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir until well chilled and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a flamed orange twist.For the Italian version, add all the ingredients to an Old Fashioned glass filled with ice.
Stir, and garnish with an orange wheel.

drinkName.name: Guadalajara Silver
drinkName.about: This tequila, apple, grapefruit juice and ginger cocktail is no runner-up.

mix.how: Mix equal amounts of sugar and cinnamon on a small plate and use to coat the rim of a rocks glass.
Fill the glass with ice.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with Granny Smith apple slices.

drinkName.name: Ancho Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: Put some chile fire in your Old Fashioned.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with one large ice block.
Cut long swatches of orange and lemon peels with a vegetable peeler.
Twist both over the drink, rub along the rim of the glass and roll together into a rosette to use as garnish.

drinkName.name: Ancho Margarita
drinkName.about: Add some spice to the classic tequila cocktail.

mix.how: Rub the lime wedge along the rim of an Old Fashioned glass and dip the rim into salt to coat it.
Fill the glass with ice and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with fresh ice.
Shake, and double-strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with the lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Conquistador
drinkName.about: This complex combo of tequila and sherry with chocolate and spice is sophisticated and delicious.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Cut a long swatch of orange peel with a vegetable peeler, twist over the drink, rub along the rim of the glass and use as garnish.

drinkName.name: Milagro Ancho Paloma
drinkName.about: Add a little heat to the Paloma cocktail with this ancho-chile spin on the classic.

mix.how: Run the lime wedge along the rim of a highball glass and coat half of the rim the salt.
Squeeze the lime wedge into the glass and discard it.
Fill the glass with ice and add the remaining ingredients.
Stir to combine and garnish with a thin grapefruit wheel.

drinkName.name: Tamarind Margarita
drinkName.about: Add a little Indian flavor to the Mexican classic with this deliciously tangy cocktail.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with salt, fill with ice and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with fresh ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Estridentista
drinkName.about: Try this intriguing cocktail featuring an ancho chile liqueur from central Mexico.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Chalchihuitl
drinkName.about: This spicy Southwestern take on the Margarita is something altogether new, with roasted poblano-infused tequila.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Barbacoa
drinkName.about: Two types of peppers combine with mezcal, citrus and ginger in this sweet-and-savory concoction.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the bell pepper slices and lime wedges.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into a double Old Fashioned glass.
Garnish with a piece of beef jerky.

drinkName.name: The Burgundy
drinkName.about: Ron would definitely approve.

mix.how: Add the whisky and ginger ale to a rocks glass filled with ice.
Top with a splash of cranberry juice.

drinkName.name: Rum Rangoon
drinkName.about: This powerful cocktail is like an instant Caribbean vacation.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange wedge.

drinkName.name: Nouveau Sangaree
drinkName.about: The old-timey version of sangria features American applejack.

ingredients.ingredient: Beaujolais nouveau wine (you may substitute another red wine)
Laird's Straight Bottled in Bond Apple Brandy
Grade B maple syrup (you may substitute other dark maple syrup)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with thin apple slices and grated cinnamon.

drinkName.name: Floradora
drinkName.about: This tall, sweet and spicy gin drink is straight from the Lone Star State.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a higball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a fresh raspberry.

drinkName.name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter
drinkName.about: Use this base to make the perfect Hot Buttered Rum in a snap.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the ice cream to a bowl and stir to combine.
Add the ice cream and stir again.
Transfer to a container with a lid, seal and store in the freezer.
Refer to the Hot Buttered Rum recipe to build the drink.

drinkName.name: South Side
drinkName.about: A simple, minty classic, the South Side is the perfect introduction to gin cocktails.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint and simple syrup.
Add the lemon juice and gin, and fill with ice.
Shake, and double-strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Serpent-less Swizzle
drinkName.about: The classic Caribbean Rum Swizzle gets an Irish whiskey makeover for a tropical St. Patrick’s Day drink.

ingredients.ingredient: Powers 12 Year Old Special Reserve Irish Whiskey

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a Pilsner glass.
Fill with crushed ice and swizzle vigorously until slightly frothy.
Garnish with a large sprig of mint and a pickled cherry.

drinkName.name: Emerald Isle of the Caribbean
drinkName.about: The classic Irish Coffee goes tiki with this hot cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: El Dorado 15 Year Old Special Reserve Rum

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a large mug, stir and top with a dollop of Tiki Whipped Cream.

drinkName.name: Good Cork
drinkName.about: The unexpected pairing of mezcal and Irish whiskey stars in this clever concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Baileys Mocha Monkey
drinkName.about: This cocktail is bananas. B-A-N-A…you get where this is going.

ingredients.ingredient: Baileys with a Hint of Coffee

mix.how: Swirl the inside of a highball glass with chocolate syrup.
Add the remaining ingredients to a blender and fill with ice.
Blend until smooth and pour into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a banana slice and 3 coffee beans.

drinkName.name: Disaronno Sour
drinkName.about: This three-ingredient classic is a great way to highlight amaretto. The recipe dates back to the 1970s when this cocktail was a staple on cocktail menus and this version, made with Disaronno, will have you yearning for the days of bell bottoms and disco. Try this recipe for the Disaronno Sour.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist and a cherry.

drinkName.name: Painkiller
drinkName.about: A twist on the Piña Colada, the Painkiller cocktail is a rich and fruity tropical drink that’s a specialty of the British Virgin Islands. Coconut cream, orange juice and pineapple juice join rum in this drink that brings the tropics right to your glass.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients into a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a hurricane glass or snifter filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and a pineapple wedge.

drinkName.name: Perfect Pearl Manhattan
drinkName.about: Try the classic bourbon and vermouth Manhattan with just a hint of smoky Scotch.

mix.how: Rinse a cocktail glass with the Scotch and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir until chilled and strain into the prepared glass.

drinkName.name: The Ginger Beer Margarita
drinkName.about: This sweet-and-fizzy pitcher cocktail is a great excuse to throw a party.

mix.how: In a small bowl, stir together the agave nectar and lime juice until the agave nectar dissolves.
Add to a pitcher, along with the tequila and ginger beer, and stir well.
Add the ice and stir until cold.
Serve in highball glasses garnished with lime wheels.

drinkName.name: Slim Organic Margarita (La Flaca)
drinkName.about: Organic tequila makes this simple version of the classic Margarita extra-special.

mix.how: If desired, coat the rim of a Martini or Margarita glass with salt and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: El Tequiletto
drinkName.about: Tequila, amaretto and OJ combine in this sweet treat.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
If desired, garnish with a lime wheel and a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: The Casa Noble Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: This south-of-the-border spin on the classic Old Fashioned calls for tequila and agave nectar.

mix.how: In an Old Fashioned glass, lightly muddle the agave nectar, bitters and orange peel.
Add the tequila and one large ice cube, and stir.
Garnish with a fresh slice of orange peel.

drinkName.name: Strawberry & Ginger Bellini
drinkName.about: This sophisticated spin on the classic Bellini is a great brunch drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and stir briefly.
Pour into a Collins or flute glass.

drinkName.name: Hazel’s Brandy Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: The Brandy Old Fashioned is a classic Wisconsin cocktail that puts a brand new spin on the age-old recipe by using brandy instead of whiskey and just a touch of 7Up. Here’s how top bartender Misty Kalkofen’s mom in Green Bay likes hers.

ingredients.ingredient:
Brandy
Try it with Martell VS

mix.how: Add the cherry, orange wedge, sugar, bitters and water into a double Old Fashioned glass.
Muddle until the sugar dissolves, adding a splash of water if needed.
Fill with ice and add the brandy.
Top with the Sprite or 7Up.
Garnish with a fresh cherry and orange wedge.

drinkName.name: Necromancer
drinkName.about: This absinthe tipple holds powerful magic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Fortune Teller
drinkName.about: While this sophisticated tequila cocktail can’t actually see your future, it is delicious.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass.
Garnish with a sprig of tarragon stuck through a small swatch of lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Boilermaker
drinkName.about: Go old-school with this straightforward whiskey and beer concoction.

mix.how: Pour the whiskey into a shot glass.
Fill a pint glass halfway with beer.
Drop the shot glass into the beer.

drinkName.name: Grand Coffee
drinkName.about: A spot of coffee never sounded so good.

mix.how: Pour all the ingredients into a mug or heat-proof highball glass and stir.
Spoon about 2 tbsp of whipped cream on top.

drinkName.name: Bloody Maria
drinkName.about: Tequila shoulders out vodka in this south-of-the-border spin on the brunch-favorite Bloody Mary. Laced with two brands of hot sauce, the Bloody Maria gains extra kick from a hefty dose of horseradish and is generously garnished with a cucumber spear, jalapeño slices and queso fresco. Make your next brunch a fiesta with this tequila-spiked Bloody Mary.

ingredients.ingredient:
Tequila
Try it with Altos Plata

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake briefly and strain into a pint glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge, a lemon wedge, a cucumber spear and a skewer of sweet pepper slices, jalapeño slices and queso fresco.

195
Save

drinkName.name: Bermuda Rum Swizzle
drinkName.about: No, it’s not a dance. But it just might spark some killer moves. To prepare a Rum Swizzle, it’s best to use an authentic swizzle stick. Real swizzle sticks are long stems snapped off a tree native to the Caribbean, and feature multiple prongs that stick out horizontally. When spun rapidly between your hands inside a cold cocktail, the swizzle stick will create a thick layer of frost on the outside of a glass—the sign of a perfect swizzle.

mix.how: Fill a pitcher a third of the way with crushed ice, and add all the ingredients.
Churn vigorously until frothing (or shake in a large shaker), and strain into 4 rocks glasses filled with fresh ice.
Garnish each with an orange slice, a pineapple cube and a cherry.

drinkName.name: Blackthorn
drinkName.about: This Irish-whiskey Manhattan has a subtle anise note.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Sidra House
drinkName.about: A tasty mix of rum, cider, sherry, pear brandy and an exotic allspice liqueur.

ingredients.ingredient: Gonzalez Byass Solera 1847 Oloroso Dulce Sherry

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with an apple fan.

drinkName.name: RumChata by Elvis
drinkName.about: The King of Rock & Roll’s favorite snack has become the stuff of junk food legend. Channel that indulgent sandwich with this equally rich combination of Rumchata’s creamy, cinnamon-laced liqueur, peanut butter, banana liqueur and chocolate syrup. Elvis would surely approve.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a blender.
Blend until smooth and pour into a tall glass.
Drizzle with chocolate syrup.

drinkName.name: English Rose
drinkName.about: With strawberries and rhubarb syrup, this gin concoction just screams spring.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the strawberries.
Add the remaining ingredients and shake without ice.
Fill with ice and shake again for 20 seconds.
Double-strain into a chilled coupe glass.

drinkName.name: Chocomole
drinkName.about: Add tequila to spicy Mexican hot chocolate and you’ll get this delicious shot recipe.

mix.how: Coat the rims of 2 shot glasses with chile powder and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glasses.
Garnish each with a corn chip.

drinkName.name: Plum Toddy
drinkName.about: Warm up with this modern twist on the traditional Hot Toddy.

mix.how: Add the liqueur and bitters to a mug.
Top with hot water and garnish with a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Shirley Temple
drinkName.about: Kids and teetotalers alike love the non-alcoholic Shirley Temple cocktail. Believe to have been originated in 1930s Hollywood, the name comes from the iconic former child star. These days, it’s a staple cocktails for children. Not into the sober life? Just add vodka or rum to booze up this classic.

mix.how: Fill a Hurricane or Collins glass with ice and add the grenadine.
Fill with ginger ale, 7UP or Sprite.
Stir, and garnish with a maraschino cherry and lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Old Oaxacan
drinkName.about: Celebrating a happy occasion? Try this Champagne-topped mezcal concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and muddle briefly.
Fill with ice, shake for 10 seconds and strain into a coupe glass.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with a lime wheel and a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Cousin Eddie
drinkName.about: This complex spin on Eggnog includes rum, armagnac and fernet.

ingredients.ingredient: El Dorado 5 Year Old Cask Aged Rum

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice.
Fill with ice and shake again.
Double-strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with a large piece of ice.
Garnish with grated nutmeg and cinnamon, and cracked black pepper.

drinkName.name: I Left My Heart in Jalisco
drinkName.about: This warm, spicy and romantic tequila cocktail makes enough for two.

mix.how: Add the milk, cocoa powder and chocolate to a saucepan over medium heat and cook, stirring, until the chocolate melts.
Add the sugar, star anise, vanilla bean, Cayenne pepper and salt, reduce the heat to low and cook for about 10 minutes.
Strain the mixture into two mugs, and add 1.25 ounces of tequila and .25 ounces of Ancho Reyes to each.
Stir, and garnish with orange twists and a sprinkle of cocoa powder.

drinkName.name: Romancing the Stone
drinkName.about: Build some romance with this sophisticated take on the classic French 75 cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (2 parts honey, 1 part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne into a shaker filled with ice, and shake until chilled.
Strain into a Champagne flute, and top with Champagne.

drinkName.name: Little Kiss
drinkName.about: You’ll fall in love with this Champagne cocktail that tastes of strawberry and chocolate.

mix.how: Add the strawberry shrub and crème de cacao to a chilled Champagne flute.
Slowly pour in the Champagne and garnish with a woodland strawberry or a tiny regular strawberry.

drinkName.name: Gin on Gin Julep
drinkName.about: This chilly and refreshing drink calls for both gin and genever.

ingredients.ingredient: Rich simple syrup (two parts sugar, one part water)

mix.how: In a Julep cup, muddle the simple syrup and mint.
Fill with crushed or pellet ice and add the genever and gin.
Top with the club soda and stir until combined.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Last Resort
drinkName.about: Pear brandy and absinthe combine to make this a truly unique tipple.

ingredients.ingredient: Rich simple syrup (two parts sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add the absinthe to a coupe glass, swirl to coat the inside, discarding any excess, and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice.
Fill with ice and shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
Strain into the prepared glass and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and a drop of Peychaud's Bitters.

drinkName.name: Hotel Nacional
drinkName.about: Add a touch of pineapple juice and apricot brandy to a classic Daiquiri to get this delicious concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with large, cold ice cubes.
Shake, and double-strain into a coupe glass.

drinkName.name: Colletti Royale
drinkName.about: Blood orange and Champagne lend delicious elegance to this tequila cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a wine glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with a blood orange wheel.

drinkName.name: Cunningham
drinkName.about: Scotch is a most unusual base for this fruity cocktail recipe.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with brandied cherries and a flamed blood orange twist.

drinkName.name: Blood Sage
drinkName.about: Seasonal blood orange and fresh sage make this gin cocktail a wintry delight.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the orange and sage.
Add the remaining ingredients and shake without ice.
Fill with ice and shake again, very hard.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a sage leaf.

drinkName.name: Blood Orange Margarita
drinkName.about: Blood orange juice and Campari transform the classic Margarita cocktail.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with salt, fill with ice and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with fresh ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a blood orange slice.

drinkName.name: Cupid’s Champagne Potion
drinkName.about: Celebrate a romantic night in with this festive sparkling drink recipe.

mix.how: Add the vodka and peach puree into a shaker and fill with ice, and shake until chilled.
Strain into a chilled Champagne flute.
Top with Champagne.

drinkName.name: Italian Love Affair
drinkName.about: Add some bite to your Spritz and enjoy this vodka cocktail with your best gal pals.

mix.how: Add the vodka and Aperol to a wine glass and fill with ice.
Stir gently and top with Champagne.
Garnish with a pink grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Malibu Mudslide
drinkName.about: Indulge in this white hot cocktail drink spiked with coconut rum.

mix.how: Add the milk and chocolate to a mug and stir until the chocolate melts completely.
Stir in the rum and top with whipped cream.
Garnish with ground cinnamon.

drinkName.name: Rose-Colored Glass
drinkName.about: Bring some romance to your glass with this easy bubbly cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Crémant d'Alsace rosé sparkling wine, to top

mix.how: Add the bitters, lemon juice and simple syrup into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a coupe glass.
Top with the sparkling wine.
Garnish with red rose petals.

drinkName.name: Bloody Bulldog
drinkName.about: No reason vodka should have a monopoly on tomato-juice cocktails.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass, fill with ice and stir.
Garnish with any of the following: a celery stalk, pickled okra, a dill pickle spear, an asparagus spear, a skewer with 3 olives, a skewer with 3 cherry tomatoes or a carrot stick.

drinkName.name: Hopped-Up Bloody Mary
drinkName.about: Hops-infused vodka makes this a brunch drink for beer lovers.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a highball glass with sea salt.
Add the remaining ingredients and stir to combine.
Fill with ice and stir again, briefly.
Garnish with a cocktail shrimp, a fennel stalk, lemon zest and freshly ground pink peppercorns.

drinkName.name: The Lookout
drinkName.about: Improve on the classic Hot Buttered Rum with sherry and mulled cider.

ingredients.ingredient: Mulled cider, hot (use your favorite recipe or packaged mix)

mix.how: Add the rum and butter to a mug and slowly pour in the mulled cider.
Sprinkle the five-spice powder on top.

drinkName.name: Moët Golden Night
drinkName.about: This sparkling pear-and-cardamom elixir is the official cocktail of the 2014 Golden Globes.

ingredients.ingredient: Cardamom pods, crushed with the side of a knife or a mortar and pestle
Moët & Chandon Imperial Brut Champagne, chilled

mix.how: In a small saucepan, bring the sugar, water and cardamom to a simmer over medium heat.
Simmer for 5 minutes, remove from the heat and let cool for 20 minutes.
Strain, and stir in the pear brandy.
(This mixture can be made up to 2 days ahead of time.) Add half an ounce of the pear-cardamom mixture to each of 6 white wine or coupe glasses.
Top each glass with 4 ounces of Champagne.
To garnish, core 2 Forelle or Seckel pears and cut into eighth-inch slices.
Garnish each glass with 3 pear slices spread into a fan shape.

drinkName.name: One-Two Punch
drinkName.about: Smoky Scotch whisky is the unexpected base for this fruity and fizzy punch.

ingredients.ingredient: Johnnie Walker Double Black Scotch Whisky

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the pilsner to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a pilsner glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the pilsner and garnish with a pinch of La Boîte Borneo N.
26 Spice Mix and a grapefruit half-wheel.

drinkName.name: Mazanasada
drinkName.about: This tequila-and-mezcal drink with apple cider and ginger beer is a delicious tipple for the fall or winter.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a Collins glass with Spice Sugar, fill with ice and set aside.
Add the tequila, mezcal cider and lemon juice to a shaker, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Fill with ginger beer and garnish with diced red apple.

drinkName.name: Apple Dandy
drinkName.about: Keep the holidays classy with this seasonal tequila tipple.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon wheel studded with cloves.

drinkName.name: Set the New Year on Fire
drinkName.about: This New Year’s Eve-inspired libation comes with all the pyrotechnics.

ingredients.ingredient: Bowmore 12 Years Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky

mix.how: Add the lime juice, cane syrup, and mint leaves to a Collins glass and press gently with a muddler.
Add the Scotch and fill with crushed ice.
Float the Campari on top and fill with more crushed ice.
Garnish with a flaming lime shell.

drinkName.name: Under the Mistletoe
drinkName.about: This gin-and-cranberry Christmas cocktail just might earn you a kiss.

mix.how: In a Collins glass, muddle the cranberries and orange.
Add the gin and simple syrup, and fill with ice.
Top with a mixture of two parts cranberry juice to one part club soda.
Stir with a thyme sprig and garnish with three additional cranberries.

drinkName.name: Ponche Navideño
drinkName.about: An essential part of Christmas in Mexico, sweet, fragrant Ponche Navideño can be found simmering away on stovetops and at traditional outdoor markets all across the country from December 12 through January 6, the period during which the holiday is celebrated. Featuring traditional Mexican flavorings such as fresh sugar cane, guavas and tejocotes (a crabapple-type fruit), the punch is spiked with a healthy dose of rum and served piping hot to ward off any winter chills. Here in the U.S., it can be hard to find these items fresh. So this recipe relies on easy-to-find ingredients that lend their Mexican flair to an irresistible rum punch.

ingredients.ingredient: Piloncillo (Mexican-style unrefined brown sugar), grated (or 1 cup packed dark brown sugar)
Tart apples, peeled, cored, finely chopped
Ripe pear, peeled, cored, finely chopped
Dried hibiscus flowers (also known as jamaica or sorrel), tied inside a square of cheesecloth

mix.how: In a large stockpot, add the water, piloncillo, cinnamon sticks, cloves and tamarind paste, and bring to a boil. Drop to a simmer, and stir to completely dissolve the tamarind paste. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Add the apples, pear, raisins and hibiscus flowers, and simmer for 15 minutes, until the fruit is soft and raisins are rehydrated.
Squeeze the remaining liquid out of the cheesecloth packet and discard. Remove the cinnamon sticks and cloves and discard. Stir in the lemon juice and rum.
Ladle the punch between 12 punch glasses, thinly slice 2 lemons, and garnish each glass with a slice.

drinkName.name: Tea and Krampus
drinkName.about: Forget tea and crumpets. This drink is named for the mythical dark companion to St. Nicholas.

ingredients.ingredient: Leopold Bros. Rocky Mountain Blackberry Liqueur

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a pint glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Trick Nog
drinkName.about: Try this modern and boozy twist on the classic Eggnog recipe.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into two punch cups.
Grate cinnamon on top and garnish with a slice of orange peel and a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Revolver
drinkName.about: Arm yourself with this bourbon and coffee liqueur cocktail. Introduced by San Francisco bartender Jon Santer in the early 2000s, the Revolver is locked and loaded with the spicy bite of rye-heavy Bulleit bourbon and a slug of coffee liqueur. Orange bitters lend subtle brightness to that dark and mysterious duo. Go ahead and pull the trigger.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice, and stir until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with a wide strip of orange peel.

drinkName.name: Joe & Misses Doe Celery Soda
drinkName.about: Recreate the deli favorite Dr. Brown’s Cel-Ray Soda in cocktail form with this unique recipe.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with a mix of celery salt and sugar.
Fill with ice and add the gin, Celery Syrup and lime juice.
Top with club soda and stir briefly.

drinkName.name: Vodka Martini
drinkName.about: Take a lesson in suave drinking with this classic Martini recipe.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.

drinkName.name: Grey Goose Parisian Martini
drinkName.about: This twist on the classic Vodka Martini recipe will transport you to the City of Light.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a Martini glass with sugar and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a blood orange wheel and a pinch of grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Grey Goose L’Orange Winter Sangria Martini
drinkName.about: With hints of elderflower and pomegranate, this Martini recipe is delicious all year round.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a rose petal.

drinkName.name: Hurricane
drinkName.about: The Hurricane is a powerful tropical rum drink that will transport you to the French Quarter. Created by Pat O’Brien in New Orleans during the 1940s, this super boozy rum-based concoction that will get the party started no matter where you are.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a large Hurricane glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange half-wheel and a cherry.

752
Save

drinkName.name: Basil Hayden’s 8th Night Toddy
drinkName.about: This hot bourbon cocktail is perfect for Hanukkah or any wintertime celebration.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker (do not add ice).
Shake, and strain into a mug or Toddy glass.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Après-Turkey
drinkName.about: Mix up this spiced concoction after a decadent Thanksgiving meal.

mix.how: Add the applejack and simple syrup to a snifter and stir.
Season to taste with grated cinnamon and nutmeg, and garnish with a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Hornitos Tequila Toddy
drinkName.about: Swap out whiskey for tequila in this twist on the classic Hot Toddy.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mug.
Stir, and let steep for one minute.

drinkName.name: Hornitos Holiday Horchata
drinkName.about: This tequila shot recipe is perfect for the holidays.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a shot glass with cinnamon and sugar, and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.

drinkName.name: The Maple Man
drinkName.about: This citrus, maple syrup and cognac cocktail is hard not to love.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lime and mandarin.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Holiday “Sauce”
drinkName.about: Cranberry sauce pairs perfectly with cognac in this fruity holiday tipple by Hennessy master mixologist Jordan Bushell.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a Martini or coupe glass with a mixture of equal parts cinnamon and sugar, and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Smashing Pumpkin
drinkName.about: Homemade lemon-pumpkin soda is easy to prepare in just a few minutes and lends the Smashing Pumpkin fresh fall flavor. A base of aged rum and allspice liqueur add warming contrast, making this the perfect way to incorporate the season’s favorite squash in your cocktails.

mix.how: Add the rum and allspice liqueur to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top with the Lemon-Pumpkin Soda and garnish with a bay leaf.

drinkName.name: Citius, Altius, Fortius
drinkName.about: Prepare for Olympic glory with this multinational cocktail.

mix.how: Add the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange half-wheel.

drinkName.name: Forbidden Apple
drinkName.about: This twist on the classic Champagne Cocktail is spiked with apple brandy and orange liqueur.

mix.how: Add the first three ingredients to a Champagne flute and top with the Champagne.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Champagne Cocktail
drinkName.about: This simple classic cocktail is the best way to improve a flute of bubbly.

mix.how: Place the sugar cube on a spoon and douse with bitters.
Drop into a Champagne flute and fill with Champagne.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Rusty Apple Toddy
drinkName.about: One sip of this hot apple-and-Drambuie cocktail will warm you to the core.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mug and garnish with a cinnamon stick.
